results.title: The Irishman
results.creator_credit: Forest Home Films, Anthony Buckley and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Elizabeth O’Connor. Set in Northern Queensland in the 1920’s, it is the story of a proud Irish Australian teamster and his family as they face the competition from motorised transport. This is the story of a family experiencing events which they cannot control in the face of progress and change. Stars Michael Craig, Simon Burke, Robin Nevin and Bryan Brown.

results.title: The Ipcress file
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Distributors, Harry Saltzman, Sidney J. Furie and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Based on Len Deighton’s bestseller and produced by Bond films’ Harry Saltzman, this video will be a welcome addition to fans of the world of spies and espionage. Michael Caine stars as British espionage agent Harry Palmer, a cynical and rebellious ex-Army sergeant who has been blackmailed into working for Britain’s secret service. He finds himself caught up in The Ipcress File, a horrifying conspiracy that involves brainwashing, murder, treachery, and implicates involvement at the highest level; M5. Cast includes Michael Caine, Nigel Green, Guy Doleman, Sue Lloyd, Gordon Jackson and Aubrey Richards.

results.title: The Invisible ghost
results.creator_credit: Monogram Pictures Corporation, Banner Productions, Sam Katzman and Joseph Lewis
results.brief_description: Bela Lugosi stars as Mr. Charles Kessler in this bizarre, noirish tale of murder and mystery. Every year on the anniversary of his failed marriage, Mr. Kessler conducts dinner with his estranged wife’s ghost within the claustrophobic confines of the house they once shared. The mysterious death of the new housemaid barely creates a disturbance due to the frequency of murders that have occurred in the house in recent months. Mr. Kessler, his daughter Virginia, and Evans the butler struggle to maintain calm as the body count escalates, and the police search for clues to the latest killings. As all the clues begin to add up it seems that the killer may be closer to home than first suspected, and that an evil force reaching beyond the grave may also be to blame. Features some unusual camera work and a fine performance from Lugosi.

results.title: The Inspector general = Happy times
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Jerry Wald and Henry Koster
results.brief_description: An assistant elixir salesman (Danny Kaye) is mistaken by the Russian villagers of Brodny as the infamous Inspector General - an envoy of Napoleon. The tale’s comic impetus is driven by bungling officials seeking to appease the false general and the tongue twisting talents of the inimitable Danny Kaye. Cast includes Danny Kaye, Walter Slezak, Barbara Bates and Elsa Lanchester. Freely adapted from Nikolai Gogol’s classic Russian story.

results.title: The Inn of the sixth happiness
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Buddy Adler and Mark Robson
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “The Small woman” by Alan Burgess this is the true story of Gladys Aylward, an English woman who went to China as a missionary in the 1900s. The film captures her involvement in the lives of the people of Yengcheng during the violent and turbulent times leading up to the Japanese invasion. Cast includes Ingrid Bergman, Curt Jurgens, Robert Donat, Richard Wattis. Nominated for an Academy Award, Best Director.

results.title: The Indian in the cupboard
results.creator_credit: Kennedy/Marshall Company, Scholastic Productions, Kathleen Kennedy, Frank Marshall, Jane Startz and Frank Oz
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Lynne Reid Banks, ‘The Indian in the cupboard’ is a heartwarming adventure about nine year old Omri who magically brings his three-inch toy Indian Little Bear to life. Some of the scenes may not be suitable for very young children however the amazing adventures of these two friends is sure to delight.

results.title: The Incredible shrinking man
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Albert Zugsmith and Jack Arnold
results.brief_description: This low-budget feature is a powerful and perverse example of American Cold War cinema. While holidaying with his wife, Scott Carey sails into a radio-active storm. He slowly becomes aware that his body is changing and he descends into despair as he continues to shrink until he is only a few inches tall. His familiar suburban world begins to transform into a nightmare jungle. The staircase becomes an impenetrable cliff wall and the family cat, a terrifying monster. Suprisingly the special effects stand the test of time. It is easy to laugh at the fears expressed in this film but the terror unleashed by the atomic bomb, and the resulting awareness of humanity’s mortality, still manages to disturb and confront. Ultimately “The Incredible Shrinking Man” turns out to be a less propagandic and more humane film than much of Cold War science-fiction.

results.title: The Incredible journey
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney and Fletcher Markle
results.brief_description: A holidaying family leave their three pets: Bodger, a bull-terrior; Tao, a Siamese cat; and Luath, a Labrador retriever in charge of a family guest, Emile. When the guest goes off hunting but fails to inform the animals, the three pets begin an incredible journey, over 200 miles to reach their owners. With the majestic Canadian countryside as a backdrop, this film is based on the book by Sheila Burnford. Starring Emile Genest, John Drainie, Tommy Tweed and Sandra Algar.

results.title: The Importance of being earnest [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions, Javelin, Two Cities Films, Teddy Baird and Anthony Asquith
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of Oscar Wilde’s brilliant play “The Importance of being earnest” (1895), adapted and directed for the screen by Anthony Asquith, is probably the best-known comedy of manners in the world. Jack Worthing and Algernon Moncrieff are friends, both bachelors operating in English society hoping to find love in a proper match. Each man has spun lies about a fake identity in order to achieve romance with Gwendolyn Fairfax and Cecily Cardew, respectively. When the two couples meet up at Cecily’s place of residence, their lies unfurl and the true selves of both are revealed. Wilde’s last play is a satire on English society and manners, wonderfully sending up the portentousness and pomposity of the upper classes. Two particularly memorable characters are the boorish snob Lady Bracknell and the dithering governess Miss Prism (the latter played with import here by Margaret Rutherford). Asquith never quite transcends the script’s theatrical origins, but does successfully recreate the cadence and spirit of Wilde’s sardonic, barbed wit.

results.title: The Ice storm
results.creator_credit: Good Machine, Ted Hope, James Schamus and Ang Lee
results.brief_description: Thanksgiving, 1973, Connecticut, and the future of the United States is in limbo. Though outwardly possessing everything a suburban family could want, inwardly, the Hoods are on thin ice. The transparent windows of the family depict a dysfunctional life of paranoid gossip and swinging key parties. Patriarch Ben Hood, barely communicates with his wife Elena. Frustrated and lonely, Elena is on the verge of an emotional breakdown, while Ben copes by having an affair with their neighbour Janey Carver. As night falls and the members of the family embark on their own sexual odyssey, clouds gather on the horizon for an ice storm that will paralyze the suburbs and transform everyone’s lives for ever. Cast includes Kevin Kline, Joan Allen, Sigourney Weaver, James Sheridan, and Christina Ricci.
